subtitle: A delicious oven bake that can be served with a medley of broccoli and cauliflower florets.

method.text: Place cod in an ovenproof dish with onion, bay leaf and milk. Cover and bake for 20 min until fish is cooked.
Meanwhile, par-boil potato slices for 5 min. Drain and rinse with cold water.
Flake cooked fish, discarding any skin and bone. Discard bay leaf and reserve milk and onion. Place cooked fish and onion in an ovenproof dish and set aside.

Melt butter in a small pan, add mushrooms. Fry for 2-3 min. Stir in flour to make a roux and cook on gentle heat for 2 min. Gradually blend in reserved milk. Bring to the boil, stirring continuously, to make a smooth sauce. Add <sup>3</sup>/<sub>4</sub> of the cheese and stir until melted. Season. Pour over fish.
Arrange potato slices around edge of the dish and sprinkle with remaining Lancashire cheese. Place in oven and cook for 20-30 min or until golden.

title: Lancashire cheese and fish hotpot
